7 Components

To do

7.1 Component

internaluntestedbeta version

The component Component is the parent class of all components in the UI Kit. It is an abstrac class that it means that it doesn't exist as a CSS class itself but as a mixin that can be inherited in any component.

egeo-c-component

@mixintestedinternal

Injects the general behavior and properties of the abstract class Component to other components of the UI Kit.

Usage

.test {
        @include egeo-c-component;
}

Will product the next result:

.test {
        box-sizing: border-box;
     position: relative;
}
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.2 Button

internaluntestedbeta version

The component Button is officially supported in <a>, <button> and <span> tags. The <input> tag has a particular behavior due to the default values and special implementation dragged from its implementation in the oldest browsers.

<input> tag can be perfectly used but keep in mind that the input type doesn't allow to use an icon inside the text (that is place in the value attribute).

egeo-c-button-modifier

@mixinuntestedinternal

Creates a new modifier which is a type of button with the properties passed as parameters. Sass True doesn't work well with mixins that generates completely new classes outside the one marked as input.

Usage

.test {
       @include egeo-c-button-modifier('warning',
                                   (background: orange, margin:0, color: white), // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier
                                   (background: black, margin:0, color: white), // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier on hover
                                   (background: blue, margin:0, color: white)  // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier on focus
                                   );
}

Will product the next result:

.test--warning {
        background: orange;
     color: white;
     margin: 0;
}

.test--warning:hover {
     background: black;
     color: white;
     margin: 0;
}

.test--warning:focus {
     background: blue;
     color: white;
     margin: 0;
}

egeo-c-button

@mixinuntestedinternal

Internally used to create the Egeo buttons in an extensible way. Sass True doesn't work well with mixins that generates completely new classes outside the one marked as input.

Compatibility IE6+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

How to extend the button

   .#{$egeo-namespace}c-button {
       @include egeo-c-button;

       // If you want to use the modifier constructor
       @include egeo-c-button-modifier('name-of-you-modifier',
                                   (background: #000, margin:0), // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier
                                   (background: #777, margin:0), // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier on hover
                                   (background: #fff, margin:0)  // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier on focus
                                   );

       // your code here
   }

How to create a new button inheriting from button

   .my-button {
       @include egeo-c-button;

       // If you want to use the modifier constructor
       @include egeo-c-button-modifier('name-of-you-modifier',
                                   (background: #000, margin:0), // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier
                                   (background: #777, margin:0), // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier on hover
                                   (background: #fff, margin:0)  // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier on focus
                                   );

       // your code here
   }

This script will create a class called my-button with the shared styles of all egeo-buttons, other class called my-button---name-of-your-modifier with the default values of the first Sass map, a pseudo-class called my-button---name-of-your-modifier:hover with the values of the second Sass map and a last pseudo-class called my-button---name-of-your-modifier:focus with the values of the third Sass map.

How to create a disabled state

Automatically, if exist a button which name is disabled, then the system will also create a pseudo-class called :disabled that will work when buttons will be tagged with the HTML5 attribute disabled.

   .my-button {
       @include egeo-c-button;

       // If you want to use the modifier constructor
       @include egeo-c-button-modifier('disabled',
                                   (background: #777, margin:0), // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier
                                   (background: #777, margin:0), // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier on hover
                                   (background: #777, margin:0)  // Sass map that includes the styles to be placed in the modifier on focus
                                   );

       // your code here
   }
Compatibility untested

How the buttons Sass maps work

There are two different Sass Maps we can work with to create new buttons or remove those that were created as default ones. The map $egeo-c-buttons is used to describe the default buttons defined in the Visual Guidelines. As is defined as !default is perfectly possible to reset it, removing all the buttons pre-configurated.

However, if you want create new buttons and keep the default ones, you can use the second map called $egeo-c-buttons-custom and define there the buttons you need to add.

The system will merge the two maps to renderize the whole buttons defined in both.

We have three inner Sass maps with properties we can modify to create new custom buttons: a map for the default state, other one for the hover state and a last one for the focus state. These Sass maps can include any CSS class. In addition, the general properties the whole buttons share between them will be created in the egeo-c-button class. So, if we want to create a new pair of buttons, we only need to add their definitions to the $egeo-c-buttons-custom map as is shown below:

$egeo-c-buttons: (
    main-1: (
                normal: (background: egeo-get-color(a1), border: 0, color: egeo-get-color(n0)),
                hover: (background: egeo-get-color(a1_dark), border: 0, color: egeo-get-color(n0)),
                focus: (background: egeo-get-color(a1_light), border: 0, color: egeo-get-color(n0))
            ),
    main-2: (
                normal: (background: egeo-get-color(a2), border: 0, color: egeo-get-color(n0)),
                hover: (background: egeo-get-color(a2_dark), border: 0, color: egeo-get-color(n0)),
                focus: (background: egeo-get-color(a2_light), border: 0, color: egeo-get-color(n0))
            )
);

The definition above will generate the next classes:

.egeo-c-button {...}
.egeo-c-button--main-1 {...}
.egeo-c-button--main-1:hover {...}
.egeo-c-button--main-1:focus {...}
.egeo-c-button--main-2 {...}
.egeo-c-button--main-2:hover {...}
.egeo-c-button--main-2:focus {...}

All properties are optional so, if you don't want your button have a background or a border, the only thing you have to do is not including in the map and it will not be renderized.

The default values of the pre-configured buttons defined in the $egeo-c-buttons map are:

<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><a class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--main-1"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-cog"></i>Main 1</a></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><span class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--main-2"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-cog"></i>Main 2</span></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><button class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--main-3"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-cog"></i>Main 3</button></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><input type="submit" class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--secondary-1" value="Secondary 1"></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><input type="button" class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--small egeo-c-button--secondary-1" value="Secondary 2"></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><input type="reset" class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--danger" value="Danger action"></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><button class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--main-3" disabled><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-cog"></i>Disabled button</button></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><button class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--rounded egeo-c-button--tool-1"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-cog"></i></button></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><button class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--rounded egeo-c-button--tool-2"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-cog"></i></button></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><button class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--rounded egeo-c-button--tool-ellipsis"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-waiting"></i></button></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><button class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--help"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-help2"></i></button></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><button class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--dropdown-1"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-cog"></i>Dropdown 1</button></div>
<div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><button class="egeo-c-button egeo-c-button--menu-1"><i class="egeo-c-icon icon-cog"></i>Menu 1</button></div>

Will be renderized to:

Main 1
Main 2

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value
$egeo-c-button true
$egeo-c-button---font-size body_medium
$egeo-c-button---height 40px
$egeo-c-button---min-width 180px
$egeo-c-button---padding 0 20px
$egeo-c-button---text-align center
$egeo-c-button---text-transform uppercase
$egeo-c-button---transition all .5s
$egeo-c-button--focus---shadow 0 0 5px 0 rgba(egeo-get-color(n8), .5)
$egeo-c-button__c-icon--first-child---margin 0 8px 0 0
$egeo-c-button__c-icon--last-child---margin 0 0 0 8px
$egeo-c-button--small---font-size body_small
$egeo-c-button--small---height 30px
$egeo-c-button--small---padding 4px 15px
$egeo-c-button--xxsmall---font-size body_small
$egeo-c-button--xxsmall---height 12px
$egeo-c-button--xxsmall---padding 0 5px
$egeo-c-button--xxsmall__c-icon---margin 0 6px 0 0
$egeo-c-buttons Sass map (main-1, main-2, main-3, secondary-1, tool-1, tool-2, tool-ellipsis, help, danger, disabled, dropdown-1, menu-1)
$egeo-c-buttons-custom Sass map

Dependencies

  • components.component
  • tools.colors
  • tools.typography
  • tools.log
  • utils.floats - only if you want to float your buttons.

7.3 Icon

tested

The Icon Component is a class to group common styles and behaviors to all icons in an Egeo app.

egeo-c-icon

@mixintestedinternal

Injects the general behavior and properties of the class Icon to other components of the UI Kit.

Note: The Icon component triggers styles in other components if is active.

Usage

.test {
        @include egeo-c-icon;
}

Will product the next result:

.test {
        box-sizing: border-box;
}

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-icon true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-icon should be included in the CSS.

Dependencies

  • component
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.3 Message

untestedin progressinternal

The Message Component is a class to group common styles and behaviors to all Messages in an Egeo app.

egeo-c-message

@mixinuntestedinternal

Injects the general behavior and properties of the class Message.

Usage

.test {
        @include egeo-c-message;
}

Will product the next result:

.test {
        box-sizing: border-box;
}

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-message true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-message should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-message---padding .5em Define the padding of the message.
$egeo-c-message---font-size 12px Define the font size of the message text.
$egeo-c-messages--custom Sass map Define custom messages which will be joined to the default ones.
$egeo-c-messages Sass map (restriction, warn, error)

Dependencies

  • component
  • tools.colors
  • tools.log
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.4 Row

untestedbeta version

The Row Component is a container which uses always 100% width and never floats.

egeo-c-row

@mixintestedinternal

Injects the general behavior and properties of the class Row to other components of the UI Kit.

Usage

.test {
     @include egeo-c-row;
}

Will product the next result:

.test {
     box-sizing: border-box;
     display: block;
}

.test:after {
     clear: both;
     content: "";
     display: table;
}

Example

<span class="egeo-c-row">Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Phasellus eget sem sem. Sed eros mi, blandit vel nulla non, sodales mollis libero.</span>
<span class="egeo-c-row">Nam faucibus aliquam mi, sit amet eleifend libero vehicula a. Fusce efficitur posuere lacus, eu tempus dolor volutpat id.</span>

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Phasellus eget sem sem. Sed eros mi, blandit vel nulla non, sodales mollis libero. Nam faucibus aliquam mi, sit amet eleifend libero vehicula a. Fusce efficitur posuere lacus, eu tempus dolor volutpat id.

The egeo-c-row AngularJS directive

@directiveuntested

Egeo provides an AngularJS directive to create rows with ease. The directive is restricted to HTML Element and called egeo-c-row. The Row component is a container so it allows to use transclude content. Below you can see the properties exposed:

Property Default value Description
content-at-right false If the content will be right aligned
content-centered false If the content will be center aligned
variant none Background colors. Now b1, b2, b3, b3_dark and b4 are set by default.

Usage

Take a look to the samples shown below to see how the properties could be used and combined to get different results:

<egeo-c-row><egeo-c-button type="submit" modifier="main-1" label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button></egeo-c-row>
<egeo-c-row data-content-at-right="true"><egeo-c-button type="submit" modifier="main-1" label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button></egeo-c-row>
<egeo-c-row data-content-centered="true"><egeo-c-button type="submit" modifier="main-1" label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button></egeo-c-row>

Variables exposed to theming

Egeo provides an AngularJS directive to create rows with ease. The directive is restricted to HTML Element and called egeo-c-row. The Row component is a container so it allows to use transclude content. Below you can see the properties exposed:

Property Default value Description
$egeo-c-row
 true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-group should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-row---backgrounds
 ('b1': egeo-get-color(b1), 'b2': egeo-get-color(b2), 'b3': egeo-get-color(b3), 'b3_dark': egeo-get-color(b3_dark),'b4': egeo-get-color(b4))
Background colors. Now b1, b2, b3, b3_dark and b4 are set by default.

Dependencies

  • component
  • clearfix
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.5 Toolbar

untestedbeta version

The Toolbar Component is a container of items which will be added one behind the other.

egeo-c-toolbar

@mixintestedinternal

Injects the general behavior and properties of the class Toolbar to other components of the UI Kit.

Usage

.test {
     @include egeo-c-toolbar;
}

Will product the next result:

.test {
     box-sizing: border-box;
     display: inline-block;
}

.test__item {
     margin: 0 0 0 8px;
}

.test__item:first-child {
     margin: 0;
}

Example

<span class="egeo-c-toolbar">
     <button>Opt 1</button>
     <button>Opt 2</button>
     <button>Opt 3</button>
</span>

The egeo-c-toolbar AngularJS directive

@directiveuntested

Egeo provides an AngularJS directive to create toolbars with ease. The directive is restricted to HTML Element and called egeo-c-toolbar. The Toolbar component is a container so it allows to use transclude content. Below you can see the properties exposed:

Property Default value Description
at-right
false
If the content will be right floated

Usage

Take a look to the samples shown below to see how the properties could be used and combined to get different results:

<egeo-c-toolbar>
  <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-1" data-label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button>
  <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-2" data-icon-left="icon-cog" data-icon-right="icon-arrow2_down" data-label="AngularJS Button"></egeo-c-button>
  <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-3" data-label="AngularJS Button"></egeo-c-button>
  <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-ellipsis" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-waiting"></egeo-c-button>
</egeo-c-toolbar>

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-toolbar true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-toolbar should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-toolbar---margin 0 0 0 8px Set the margin by default for the whole items in the toolbar.
$egeo-c-toolbar--first-child---margin 0 Set the margin by default for the first element in the toolbar (typically zero).

Dependencies

  • component
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.7 App Header

in progressuntested

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-app-header true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-app-header should be included in the CSS.

7.8 Button Group

untestedbeta version

The Button Group component is a wrapper to group a set of Egeo Buttons. You can use only the CSS styles but probably has no sense due to the whole functionality is only available via the AngularJS Directive.

Warning: The Button Group is, mainly, an AngularJS directive and, as such, is better defined in the UI Kit Documentation. Here you will only find basic CSS needed to compliment the button CSS itself and the way to position and manage the group of them.

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-buttongroup true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-buttongroup should be included in the CSS.

Dependencies

  • component
  • button
  • popover
Compatibility untested

7.9 Popover

internaluntestedbeta version

The Popover component, for now, is only available inside other components like the Button Group. For that, in terms of code available to work with, only the CSS has real influence in the code. In short term, this component will be available to be included as a directive in any other component itself.

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-popover true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-popover should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-popover---background #fff Set the background of the popover.
$egeo-c-popover---border 0 Set the border of the popover.
$egeo-c-popover---border-radius 5px Set the border-radius of the popover.
$egeo-c-popover---box-shadow $egeo-o-box-shadow---box-shadow Tells egeo if the popover should use the o-box-shadow to draw the box-shadow of the popover.
$egeo-c-popover---padding 10px 0 Set the padding of the popover.
$egeo-c-popover---width 300px Set the width of the popover.
$egeo-c-popover---shadow-color $egeo-o-box-shadow---shadow-color Set the color of the shadow of the popover. This color is a reference to be used as a mask to keep the feeling of uniform (no matter that the box-shadow uses three or more distinct colors, you should set here the average one).
$egeo-c-popover__listitem---margin 0 Set the margin of the list items inside the popover.
$egeo-c-popover__listitem---padding 7px 25px Set the padding of the list items inside the popover.
$egeo-c-popover__listitem---color egeo-get-color(a1) Set the color of the list items inside the popover.
$egeo-c-popover__listitem--hover---background egeo-get-color(n3) Set the background of the list items inside the popover on hover.
$egeo-c-popover__listitem__icon---color egeo-get-color(a1) Set the color of the icons in the list items inside the popover.
$egeo-c-popover__arrow---size 8.5px Set the size of the arrow which points to the origin of the popover.

Dependencies

  • component
Compatibility untested

7.10 Form

untestedbeta version

The Form component is a wrapper to group all components inside an HTML Form logically related to the CSS.

egeo-c-form

@mixinuntested

At present, the component only includes the basic behavior inherited from component.

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-form true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-form should be included in the CSS.

Dependencies

  • component
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.11 Form Group

untestedbeta version

The Form Group component is a wrapper to group components inside an HTML Form that can be joined to work together. A typical example of a form group is a label with an input.

egeo-c-formgroup

@mixinuntested

At present, the component only includes the basic behavior inherited from component with an extra to manage the margin.

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-formgroup true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-formgroup should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-formgroup---margin 0 0 8px Define the margins around the form group.

Dependencies

  • component
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.12 Form Control

untestedbeta version

The Form Control component is an abstract class which is inherited by the components which belong to a form. It includes a series of default properties and behaviors all child components could inherit as well, modify or complete overwrite by their owns.

egeo-c-formcontrol

@mixinuntestedinternal

This mixin is used by the form controls to inherit a default and common behavior and appearance. It can be used to create new custom form controls, extending it v√≠a include in our own classes.

These classes which inherit from egeo-c-formcontrol are designed to work with egeo-c-form and egeo-c-formgroup so keep it in mind when you create new form controls or extend them.

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-formcontrol true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-formcontrol should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-formcontrol---background n0 Set the background by default of all form controls.
$egeo-c-formcontrol---border 1px solid Set the border by default of all form controls.
$egeo-c-formcontrol---box-shadow $egeo-o-box-shadow---box-shadow If we don't want to use the egeo-o-box-shadow, Egeo will use this variable to set the box shadow of the form controls.
$egeo-c-formcontrol---color n10 Set the font color by default of all form controls.
$egeo-c-formcontrol---font-size body_medium Set the font size by default of all form controls.
$egeo-c-formcontrol---line-height null Set the line height by default of all form controls.
$egeo-c-formcontrol---padding 3px 5px Set the padding by default of all form controls.

Dependencies

  • component
  • form
  • form group
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.13 Input

testedalpha version

The Input Component is a class to show the Ege ocustom version of an HTML input tag.

egeo-c-input

@mixintestedinternal

Apply the whole styles needed to customize a input.

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-input true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-input should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-input---box-shadow none Define the box shadow of the input.
$egeo-c-input---border 0 Define the border of the input.
$egeo-c-input---border-bottom 1px solid egeo-get-color(n6) Define specifically the border-bottom of the input.
$egeo-c-input---font-size body_large Define the font size of the input.
$egeo-c-input--focus---border-bottom 1px solid egeo-get-color(n10) Define the border-bottom when the input has the focus.
$egeo-c-input__popover---left 1px Define the left position of the popover when the input has help.
$egeo-c-input__popover---top 15px Define the top position of the popover when the input has help.
$egeo-c-input__placeholder---color n7 Define the font color of the placeholder.
$egeo-c-input__placeholder---font-style italic Define the font style of the placeholder.

Dependencies

  • component
  • formcontrol
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.14 Label

tested

The Label Component is a class to show the Egeo custom version of an HTML label tag.

egeo-c-label

@mixintestedinternal

Apply the whole styles needed to customize a label.

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-label true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-label should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-label---background transparent Define the background of the label.
$egeo-c-label---border 0 Define the border of the label.
$egeo-c-label---box-shadow none Define the box-shadow of the label.
$egeo-c-label---color a1 Define the font color of the label.
$egeo-c-label---font-size body_xxsmall) Define the font size of the label.
$egeo-c-label---font-style null Define the font style of the label.
$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---color a1 Define the color of the optional mark if it joins the label.
$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---content '(optional)' Define the content of the optional mark if it joins the label.
$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---font-style null Define the font style of the optional mark if it joins the label.
$egeo-c-label__icon---color n5 Define the color of the icon if any icon joins the label.
$egeo-c-label__icon---font-size body_xsmall) Define the font size of the icon if any icon joins the label.

Dependencies

  • component
  • formcontrol
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.15 Checkbox

Untestedalpha version

The Checkbox Component is a class to show the Egeo custom version of an HTML input checkbox tag.

egeo-c-checkbox

@mixinuntested

Apply the whole styles needed to customize a checkbox.

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-checkbox true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-checkbox should be included in the CSS.

Dependencies

  • component
  • formcontrol
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+

7.16 Helpbox

untestedin progressinternal

The helpbox Component is a wrapper to show the help messages.

egeo-c-helpbox

@mixinuntestedinternal

Injects the general behavior and properties of the class helpbox.

Usage

.test {
     @include egeo-c-helpbox;
}

Variables exposed to theming

Variable Default value Description
$egeo-c-helpbox true Tells Egeo if the class egeo-c-helpbox should be included in the CSS.
$egeo-c-helpbox---background n0 Define the background of the helpbox.
$egeo-c-helpbox---border-top 1px solid egeo-get-color(n0) Define the border-top style of the helpbox.
$egeo-c-helpbox---color n0 Define the font color of the text inside the helpbox.
$egeo-c-helpbox---shadow-color n4 Define the base color of the shadow that emits the helpbox.
$egeo-c-helpbox__arrow---size 8px Define the size of the arrow (in px) of the helpbox.

Dependencies

  • component
  • tools.layers
Compatibility IE8+, Firefox 29+, Chrome 10+, Edge 12+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 9.5+
Created using kss-node and kss-node-template.
